Hi @Olga! I'm Hugi, one of the founders of Blivande. Thanks, @darkturo for the introduction.

[quote="Olga, post:1, topic:1652"]
* An open space where we could spend around 3 hours for distributing the ‘rescued food’ once per week, preferably Saturday mornings (flexible schedule). We do not need a kitchen in this space, just a couple of tables and a plug to potentially use a fridge (that we already have).
* Access to Frihamnstorget kitchen to organize folkkök events once/twice per month (great flexibility for dates/times).
[/quote]

What a fantastic initiative. I completely support this! I am truly excited about this happening in the house. This is exactly the sort of initiative we should serve. Let's talk about how to make this work in practice! 

My initial thoughts, based on your information:

Blivande is a participatory community. Our members take initiative to create what happens in the house and also take responsibility for those who participate in the events they organize. Ideally, a member of Blivande should take it upon themselves to be present and responsible for this activity before, during, and after it takes place. This includes greeting people, making sure they understand where they are, making sure that doors to private areas are closed and locked, and that Blivande is left clean and tidy after it's done. All of our members hold keys to the house, and have access 24/7.

As for timing, Saturday mornings are not a very busy time at Blivande, so it's good. The only problem could be that if there has been a party or event the day before, which is usually the case in normal times, the cleaning might still be ongoing. This is probably not a showstopper, but I will leave it up to @hampus to make the call as he is in charge of the event side of things. Blivande is also a very dynamic and active place, and things are quite fluid, so the person responsible would have to keep themselves in the loop with the community.

Foodsharing Stockholm is very close to the core purpose of Blivande. When an opportunity like that presents itself, we like to give it an extra push. For example, we have given people "community" memberships in the past for doing work that contributes to the commons. Foodsharing Stockholm contributes to the commons of Blivande and Stockholm as a whole, so **I propose that Blivande sponsor someone on the Foodsharing Stockholm team with a free membership** to our workshops (called a [Studio Tau membership](https://forum.blivande.com/t/2-create/902)). They would become a full member, with access to all of our workshops and tools, and have their own key to the house with 24/7 access. In return, they are responsible for the collaboration with Foodsharing Stockholm and for making that collaboration work with the rest of our members.

From our end, this means that we establish a relationship with someone on the team. For us, personal relationships are everything and would help us commit fully to this collaboration. An ideal person would be someone who:
* Is conscientious and orderly
* Otherwise a good fit for Studio Tau and the rest of the members 

It would be even better if that person would also:
* Benefit from the free art studio and workshop membership
* Live relatively close (although that's mostly for convenience for that person)

This way, we could really make Foodsharing Stockholm a part of the community and make resources available for each other. What do you think of this model @Olga?

We would need to discuss this with the whole Blivande team and check in with the members, but my feeling about it is positive.

**Var bor du? Where do you live?**

Artist, designer, developer, teacher

33

**Vad anser du är Frihamnens identiet/What do you consider to be the identity of Frihamnen?**
Woozy, Danish. Hipp & Happ. Oh, thought it was Frihamnstorget. The identity of Frihamnstorget currently is closer to a dead fish in a lil' bowl, with Stockholm youth moving in and out with their paddle rackets. It's like the place in an old western film, when they arrive to an abandoned town and the tumbleweeds flow by.

**Vilken slags näring vill du ska etablera sig i Frihamnen t.ex. livsmedel, detaljhandel, restauranger osv? What type of busniesses would you like to be established in Frihamnen?**
Food, drinks, popup artsy shops. Cozy fika place. No, but really, I think we need to get some people moving in and out.

An old school cinema, like the Prince something-something in Dalston, London.

**Vad tycker du om friluftslivet/tillgången till natur i Frihamnen? What do think of the outdoor life in Frihamnen?**
It's pretty dire, unless you make the walk to Gärdet, and get lost in the woods, then it's alright.

Would like it to be a hub for creativity, a lab for action, a space for dreaming - rather than solely a source of entertainment, storage, food and drinks. Vill säga mycket bra jobbat! Kommer så klart hjälpa till så mycket jag kan. 

Det finns även ett stort plåtskåp tillgängligt, om man monterar en låsmekanism på med ett kod/hänglås kanske det skulle fungera för att låsa in utrustning? 

Andra frågor är, finns ett bra snyggt höj och sänkbart bord. Är det inte bra att ha ett sådant? När man jobbar där kan det va bra med ett bord för dator utrustning etc. 

Finns även ett bra lågt skåp i lokalen i bromma låsbart plåt, skulle få platts exakt under ett skrivbord. (Om det är kvar) 

Sen måste vi planera ang hur vi hänger upp rör, har klurat på det länge även för TT är nog viktigt att vi gör det ”rätt” och säkert. Stör mig varje dag jag går in i studion och noterar ögglorna i taket som sitter fel enligt ”riggnings regler och normer” (ska absolut inte sitta vågrätt utan lodrätt) är personligen öppen för många lösningar så länge man inte gör ögonfallande fel som någon branchkunning person kan se kanske inte är farligt men anser det lite pinsamt. 
Till detta vill jag påpeka att mycket beror på vilket tyg man använder. Burtontyger av god kvalitee väger ca 500g kvm och behöver kraftig upphängning. Det tyget vi kan köpa från gierta är ett mörkläggningstyg svart. Om jag förtått det rätt är de relativt lätta men av hög kvalitee som inte släpper in ljus (tunna burtontyger är dessvärre lite halvt genomskinliga) beroende på hur tyget är så får vi se hur vi sätter upp det. Det har tidigare suttit i skena på operan, så om vi har tur finns det anordning för att hänga (dvs är fållat och fixat som mörkläggningsgardin) tycker vi börjar med att köpa in tyget är ett jättebra pris. Sen klurar vi på upphängning beroende på hur det är.

Davids rör är bra de är av aluminium det finns en tunnare 25mm variant som är lämplig för tyger. De är längre. Tyvärr är de som är 50mm std korta är därmed därför jag kollar med kontakt ang att köpa stålrör å 6m 50mm 2mm tjocklek. Ang tt är de mycket snyggare då de inte är blanka. Kanske är en fördel för fotostudion med? Personligen tycker jag rostiga rör är snyggare en aluminium. 

Ska försöka ta in ett pris på stålrör har en kontakt som i mån om tillgång kan ge mig mycket bra pris om man köper en lagom stor mängd. 

Ang el kan vi få fram en plan? Bör planera detta korrekt så inte uttag används som delas med andra rum, är just ett specifikt uttag som om proppen går slocknar nödbelysning samt halva ljuset i TT. Finns ju en 32a nu i lokalen. Jag har massor med centraler jag kan låna till rummet, plockade bla upp en 32a byggcentral i veckan från en byggsäck på gatan! Regnluckan är trasig men använder man den permanent inomhus är det ok. Är den större modellen. Har även några 16a centraler som ej bör användas utomhus. (Sprucken plast bara å limma) kabel har vi en hel del kanske köpa in lite kontakter och sitta och klippa å laga, annars är malmbergs billiga på kabel. Har liknande projekt i TT med att få upp ström i trossen så vet ej om det räcker. Ang kabel vill jag att vi använder proffsdosorna dvs de svarta med två tre uttag som man kan öppna och montera på kabel (dvs ej fix) och de saknar petskydd. Är ok innom proffsverksamhet att inte ha petskydd. Är snarare farligt med petskydd slits och orsakar brand etc samt är jobbigt när man dinglar på en stege och försöker sätta i en kontakt. 

Jag tar med mig lite fler centraler till blivande tillsvidare, har även abnorma mängder vita vanliga skarvdosor i mitt förråd. Vill dock inte lägga fram för många de har en tendens att ”försvinna” de vita billigare är ok men de av proffskvalitet vill jag att de inte hamnar på vilovägar behöver de själv på event. Är ok om simon använder för jag vet att de kommer tillbaka men stör mig när man tar med massor med grejer och sen när man själv ska ha de är de väck eller helt plötsligt bortglömda längs in i en container.

Hello again Olga! :)

It's reiterating what we've already talked about in the initial chat so I'll just say that I'm really happy to see how you've jumped on the suggestion to bring this to the forum and also make this a Frihamnstorget-connected thing! I added you to the Noden open community group after our chat the other day and as Diana also points to here that is indeed a good place for you to find more people and volunteers. 

As mentioned the kitchen container we have there could be made available to host regular Folkkök-events that would be easy to make synergize with other types of activities and culture. Come for the food, stay for the X-kind of thing. 

Further down the line if everything pans out well and takes root in Frihamnen the growing project could potentially get its own container. Food refrigeration is a very common usage of specialized containers and such a container could also act as a large fridge for other events and ventures existing in the future square. 

Another thing that I would like to mention here and that you and others in your group might be interested in is that there are aligned ideas floating around all over Sweden for starting food co-ops inspired by organizations such as [Park Slope Coop](https://www.foodcoop.com/). 

A trailer for a documentary about it here: https://vimeo.com/ondemand/foodcoopthefilm

We have community members like Pietro and Nadine who's been trying to start up such an organization in Stockholm for a while now and while that's a really big project to pull off initiatives such as yours could act as auxiliary stepping stones on the way. 

Of course urban farming initiatives as mentioned by Tobi above are also potential allies in a networked coalition for food sustainability in the city. There's people at Utopia Arkitekter that I plan to contact about that as they are currently looking into ways of enabling more small-scale food production within the city. Would love to see Frihamnen in general, with Frihamnstorget in particular as its connecting hub, be a node for this kind of initiatives in Stockholm. 

You mention Sopköket and I've bumped into Filip since around the time he started it. They're doing good work! At one point we briefly exploed collaborating in Frihamnen when they were looking for a production site there but we never managed to find the right space for them at the time.

Sorry for the late reply @jonasjohansson! I was glad to see you post about this as personal initiative is the only thing that will push Studio Tau along towards being fully operational, living up to its potential and promise. 

We have several people experienced with laser cutters but the current limitation is the lack of a room with proper ventilation. We can however - now that it's summer - get away with temporarily working with an open window allowing for an exhaust tube to be pulled out. I've been informed today by @hugi that @annielocke and David Giertta are working on getting the laser cutter up and running as its needed for the BL Temple build. Best would be to join forces with them so as to speed up that process. 

I'm personally strongly in favor of having both our laser cutter and a CNC that I'm also working on getting here placed inside a container. This would side-step the whole permit question around ventilation holes in the facade as well as free up much needed space in Tau for other things . It would also of course make the operations more mobile as we could for example move a CNC to BL and other events of interest and relevance. Perhaps in collaboration with the STEAMobile of Folk Lab and so on and so forth. 

On this note I will contact Containertjänst tomorrow and see if we can quickly invest in a 20" container for this purpose. It would be placed 100 m2 from the Tau entrance where there is already an existing 62A power outlet. In a month or two we might end up having it placed even closer to us on the Containerville parking lot (Frihamnstorget) that we're about to build in collaboration with Stockholms Hamnar. Just across the street from House Blivande. 

David Giertta has serviced the laser before and has agreed to do this for us here in the future (if we pay him). I  fully agree that the laser cutter is vital to Tau and personally think that its service and maintenance should be professionalized based on the experiences from Stugan. We should also implement some kind of course in how to use it, held regularly so all interested members can be educated in its basic operation and maintenance. To be clear I'm stating this *opinion* as a fellow member of Tau and not a Blivande representative. If you after your meeting conclude that you do want to take this on yourselves (the continuous service and maintenance) then I of course will not object to that but rather applaud it.

**Var bor du? Where do you live?**
Stockholm

**Vad arbetar du med? What is your occupation?**
PhD

**Hur gammal/ung är du? How old are you?**
30

**Vad anser du är Frihamnens identiet/What do you consider to be the identity of Frihamnen?**
A space for experimentation, community and expression

**Vilken slags näring vill du ska etablera sig i Frihamnen t.ex. livsmedel, detaljhandel, restauranger osv? What type of busniesses would you like to be established in Frihamnen?**
Community kitchen or furniture interior design with items from local and starting entrepreneurs

**Vad annat skulle du önska fanns i Frihamnen som inte finns idag? What other kind of activities and places would you like to see in the future in Frihamnen?**
More green. More play and gathering places. Mixed genders and ages. Skatepark, boule, art gallery, community kitchen, connections with suburbs and other cultures. Just anything what is not already in the inner city. There is a very long queue for the kolonilotten, there could possibly be a new one - though community driven? This question is a bit too broad - like what would be possible, what is the frame? What is the future of Frihamnen?

**Vad tycker du om friluftslivet/tillgången till natur i Frihamnen? What do think of the outdoor life in Frihamnen?**
Some badplatser in Stockholm are really popular and with an increasing population, these places become overcrowded. This side of Stockholm barely has any place to go into the water or interact with the water. Some other activities that support and form synergy with Blivande.

**Beskriv kort hur du önskar att Frihamnen ser ut år 2040? Describe your vision for Frihamnen in 2040?**
I would be happy to see the area being developed through co-creation and hopefully inspired by the ten burning man principles. What do Stockholmers want, what can be created organically, students, associations, etc.

**Finns det något annat du vill tillägga gällande platsutveckling i Frihamnen? Is there anything else you would like to add concering the placemaking of Frihamnen?**

>Och även om vi har olika tankar och tro då respekterar vi varandra

Och även om vi har olika tankar och tro **så** respekterar vi varandra *eller* Och även om vi har olika tankar och tro respekterar vi varandra.

>Även om ni tror i astrologi eller om jag tror inte att gluten är dålig till mig!

Även om ni tror **på** astrologi eller om jag **inte tror** att gluten är dålig**t för** mig!

>Sedan behöver jag någon som lyssna till mig och ge mig råd och visa mig att världen är inte så mörk som jag tror.

**Då** behöver jag någon som lyssna**r på** mig och ge**r** mig råd och visa**r** mig att världen **inte är** så mörk som jag tror.

>Ibland är jag arg och sen behöver jag någon som lyssna men säger ingen och låt mig klaga till jag är inte arg längre. 

Ibland är jag arg och **då** behöver jag någon som lyssna**r utan att säga något** och låt**er** mig klaga till**s** jag **inte är** arg längre. 

>Ibland är det ni som är ledsen eller arg och sen lyssnar jag och ger råd om det behövs eller en kram, den behövs egentligen alltid. Jag är glad om jag kan hjälpa er och att ni lita på mig i den samma sätten hur jag lita på er.

Ibland är det ni som är leds**na** eller arg**a** och **då** lyssnar jag och ger råd om det behövs. **Eller** en kram, **det** behövs egentligen alltid. Jag är glad om jag kan hjälpa er och att ni lita**r** på mig **på samma sätt som** jag lita**r** på er.

>Det är kanske den viktigaste att jag alltid kan vara mig själv när jag är oss er. På jobbet måste jag dölja en stor del av mig. Men ofta är det delen jag gillar mest! Det är delen som dansa på en rave i skogen och delen som går till kink-klubben i Berlin och delen som ligga i en stor cuddle-puddle, naken. Delen som knarkar, det måste man troligen också nämna här. Men när jag gör alla den här grejer är ni med mig och gör det tillsammans med mig och det gör det ännu bättre!

Det är kanske **det** viktigast**e,** att jag alltid kan vara mig själv när jag är **med** er. På jobbet måste jag dölja en stor del av mig, **men** ofta är det **den del** *eller* **den delen** jag gillar mest! Det är delen som dansa**r** på **ett** rave i skogen och delen som går **på kink-klubb** i Berlin och delen som ligg**er naken** i en stor cuddle-puddle. **Och** *eller* **Den** delen som knarkar, det måste man troligen också nämna här. Men när jag gör alla **de** här grejer**na** är ni med mig och gör det tillsammans med mig och det gör det ännu bättre!

**Ett kärleksbrev till mina vänner**

Mina älskade vänner,

 

Vad glad jag är att ni finns. Och vad glad jag är att ni är glad att jag finns. Vad fina och varma och roliga och konstiga och helt underbara ni är. Jag tycker att jag säger det inte tillräckligt ofta. Jag är så tacksam för att ha er i mitt liv av många anledningar. Här är några men inte alla:

 

Jag är tacksam att jag får se världen genom era ögon och att jag får höra era tankar och åsikter. Ofta har vi samma åsikt och jag känner mig förstådd och förstärkt i min världsbild. Det också händer att vi har olika åsikter och då diskuterar vi, försöker att förstå varandra och förklarar våra tankar. Ni är alltid öppen till nya perspektiv och hjälpar mig att också vara öppen. Jag tror att mina samtal med er gör mig till en bättre person. Och även om vi har olika tankar och tro då respekterar vi varandra. Även om ni tror i astrologi eller om jag tror inte att gluten är dålig till mig! 

 

Ibland är jag ledsen. Sedan behöver jag någon som lyssna till mig och ge mig råd och visa mig att världen är inte så mörk som jag tror. Och det gör ni. Ibland är jag arg och sen behöver jag någon som lyssna men säger ingen och låt mig klaga till jag är inte arg längre. Och det gör ni också.

Ibland är det ni som är ledsen eller arg och sen lyssnar jag och ger råd om det behövs eller en kram, den behövs egentligen alltid. Jag är glad om jag kan hjälpa er och att ni lita på mig i den samma sätten hur jag lita på er. 

 

Det är kanske den viktigaste att jag alltid kan vara mig själv när jag är oss er. På jobbet måste jag dölja en stor del av mig. Men ofta är det delen jag gillar mest! Det är delen som dansa på en rave i skogen och delen som går till kink-klubben i Berlin och delen som ligga i en stor cuddle-puddle, naken. Delen som knarkar, det måste man troligen också nämna här. Men när jag gör alla den här grejer är ni med mig och gör det tillsammans med mig och det gör det ännu bättre!

 

Tre anledningar av många. Tack för att ni finns och tack för att ni är mina vänner. 

Jag älskar er.

Wanda

I agree with leaving the principles out of the bylaws. But I think we have another problem here. The old bylaws have a concrete purpose (to promote spirituality and syntheism). The proposed new bylaws replaces this with the 10 principles, which are super vague (too vague for bylaws). But to not replace it at all means that the only purpose of Noden is to promote co-creation culture, which is also quite vague.

I'm not sure if this is a discussion to have regarding the bylaws, and I'm not sure how concrete we need to be here. But I do think that we need to have a discussion on how to formulate the purpose of Noden in a very concrete way.

Hi
I have a small welding company in Södertälje and I work on small metal custom designs up to big infrastructure projects. I do prototyping aside with 3D printing and CAM and I have experience with almost all kinds of materials,as well in electrics and a basic knowledge in electronics. I am not especially creative myself but I can teach (especially welding) and help others to reach their goals.
As a reference, I built the flame throwing steel tree for Playaground at Borderland 2017. Unfortunately I forgot to take pictures.
I can also contribute with machines since I am running out of space in my workshop, for example this (www.maslowcnc.com) 2.5D CNC router which I was planing to equip with a laser and plasma cutter as well.

In the Blivande Academy I've added [Electro Bling](https://dreams.blivande.com/blivande-academy/5f99e856e0abb4002c80f672), a 3-hour workshop where participants invest in a custom configuration of LEDs and controllers, and with provided tools and bits, we create illuminated accessories.

It's a beginner introduction to coding, electronics and tinkering, with the end goal of having our own custom electronic bling. And yes, soldering will happen.

1. Would you be OK with investing 500 SEK for this workshop? 80% goes to fund the materials, which you get to keep.
2. Are you into learning some basics of programming (my approach is "easy to learn, fun to master"), electronics and soldering?
3. Love lights and animations, and believe that you should be a walking disco ball? (yes, yes, yes!)

Please let me know by a comment, and we'll try to make it happen.

Note, you may also bring your gear (shoes, dress, hat etc.) and pimp it!

I've been thinking hard on how to bring to life at least a discussion about my thoughts around the "Blivande Academie" sparked by @MariaEuler and now also reading the first intro by @Niki.

I thought to paste my thoughts here as this is way out from my comfort zone in terms of getting things organized.

===== My thoughts ======

**Working for a living** takes up most of people awake hours. Sleep 8
hours, work 8 hours, try to fit in everything else – like washing,
resting, loving and caring 8 hours. Finding time for learning and
exploring is not easy.

**Employment is normally focused on getting shit done** from a productivity point of view. Its not uncommon that education withing a corporate context get little room in the every day practice. Also education in a profession, is often directly connected to the actual business or to the line of work that you are hired to perform.

> Finding time to learn is almost in a conflict with the process of making a living.

**The exception is of course** people working directly within academia, where the learning process itself is what makes the living. But persons within academia has its own problems, not seldom tided to economy. How do you raise money to learn, research and study your passion subject if nobody is
prepared to pay for it?

**What if there is a way** to establish a learning sphere in the middle between academia and
business - tying that in to the Blivande Community, mixing in the principles from Burning Man, Syntheistic philosophy and Participatory culture that already flourish there? How would such a academy environment work and what would it teach/study/make?

**Would it attract a "for profit interest"** because of this extraordinary mix of philosophy, art, creativity and community to make it sustainable? 

**Would it attract teachers** willing to connect art, philosophy and science to grow people into artisans in their field, in the context at which we intend to place it at Hus Blivande?

**How do we facilitate the learning process is another question to think about.** Do we seek a formalized academic method and process or is the creative environment in itself enough for a  learning and academic dimension? Can an academy work without an already established format for  research and academia?

> It is truly an intriguing thought to create an academy that merges and teaches philosophies from the culture in Hus Blivande and make that sustainable with a for profit element. I'm definitely interested.

@RobertPenten Check out this thread about hosting paid courses through Blivande. Could be interesting for you. I think car mechanics/repairs would be a super popular topic for many to explore, especially if it's combined with working on a nice classic car such as your 60's Land Rover.

Hi everyone!
I thought I would reintroduce myself also with some new information based on my meetings with @MariaEuler these last few weeks.

I'm Niki and I have previously worked in education organising workshops and lessons in tech and design. Today I work as an innovation designer crossing over UX, UI, graphic design, and product design. I reached out to Blivande as I have recently moved to Stockholm from London and have been looking to be part of a creative hub in Stockholm. I am a natural maker and I love starting crazy projects, big or small.

After speaking with Maria I understood that there's a need for an organiser to make the Blivande Akademi a reality. I love this initiative and am gladly taking over this role! I will try my best to cater to all facilitators' wishes and needs in regard to this project, and to make this wonderful idea become reality. 

As a starting point, what I see that we need is:
- An overarching theme or mission of the initiative to help clarify for the potential participants what we are doing, what Blivande is, and what they can expect.

- Making it easy for the potential participants to sign up and get information. This might mean a website with info, contact info and a sign-up system. 

I have a suggestion on first point which is the theme of the initiative which I want to share in our meeting together (see Maria's post above) If anyone has an idea about the second point, or if the dreams platform can be used for this, it would be great! I am still getting a hang of the resources available so I might need some explaining or informing of the different platforms that already exist. 

"The sum of the cardamum" is that I would like to still try and get at least three workshops happen next week, they might be small and hard to find participants to this late, but we can see it as a trial for us organisers and facilitators as well. So if we can have a meeting tomorrow Friday in order to get the theme, sign-up system, and workshops pinned down I think we have what we need to make this happen. If you as a facilitator needs anything at all as in throwing around ideas, answering questions about the workshops then please do not hesitate and contact me!

Have a great day and remember to vote! (for the meeting day:)

[quote="rogerb, post:16, topic:1618"]
For me, what is interesting and good about Noden that it mostly embodies the principles of Burning Man, and as I understand it, Burning Man is the birthplace of Noden. I see Noden as a place to evolve and disseminate burner culture, and ideas like gifting, de-commodification and participation are particularly important to me.
[/quote]

Well Roger, as the founder of Noden I can just say that this simply isn't factually true. I went to Burning Man for the first time in 2015 and I had started the journey towards creating something like the Node already in 2012. That process was turbocharged by the passing of my father in 2014. We had a contract and keys for the old Node from May in 2015, almost 4 months before I went to Burning Man.

Burning Man is certainly *one* source of indirect inspiration through the vector of Borderland. 

This said I do fully concur in that I think it's important to safeguard that the Node continues to represent something a bit more profound than being a mere workshop venue. I don't agree however that wedding it more officially to Burning Man will accomplish that. Burning Man (org) is a corporate dinosaur, relatively speaking, and is facing huge issues. The American Burner culture (unsurprisingly given the leadership) also has big inherent challenges ahead of itself.

Hey Filiip! I am working on exactly that for the activity Plan right now. And I am getting inspired by the following:

# Webpage:
**NODEN IS A RADICAL EXPERIMENT IN COMMUNITY BUILDING UNDER THE ROOF OF [BLIVANDE](http://www.blivande.com/) IN FRIHAMNEN.**

What unites the activities taking place is that they are all created with the intention of bringing people together, ideally contributing towards reinforcing a sense of purpose and meaning in our everyday lives.

Hundreds of people come through our doors every week to visit this "home away from home" and we believe that we have, more often than not, succeeded in our mission of creating a transitional - and hopefully transformational - threshold or "twilight zone" in between the public and the private realm.

A place where things are open to change, and perhaps so are you. To some that can take for instance the form a [ ***drumming workshop*** ](https://www.facebook.com/events/2909786439062195/), a [ ***safe open stage*** ](https://www.facebook.com/groups/2089133457765779/) or a [ ***rave in complete darkness*** ](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1801604596752480/). But only if you and others actively choose to make it so by taking and sharing the necessary responsibility to make it happen. We are completely non-profit, co-created and member-motivation-based organisation!

# Bylaws Thread:

“Föreningen har som syfte att främja medlemmarnas och allmänhetens intresse av deltagande i medskaparkultur och samvaro i enlighet med (eller inspirerade av) föreningens principer.”



### I will post the texts in the application thread as soon as I am done, the activity plan layout will take about longer I suppose

I'm totally in love with the principles. It is clear to me that they make all the difference. Without them, the community culture would not be what it is today. At all. "Föreningen har som syfte att främja medlemmarnas och allmänhetens intresse av och deltagande i medskaparkultur." is far to vague to create a cultural direction, going forward. How about a middle way, not making the principles explicit within the bylaws however we refer to the 10 (or 11) principles until they are morphed in subsequent process, when someone wants to lead that. 

Something like this: "Föreningen har som syfte att främja medlemmarnas och allmänhetens intresse av deltagande i medskaparkultur och samvaro i enlighet med (eller inspirerade av) föreningens principer."

@MariaEuler posted something very interesting over at Edgeryders.  

https://edgeryders.eu/t/paid-duct-taping-vs-unpaid-creation-working-value-system-not-found/13466

> Bellow you find a snipped from David Graeber’s book “Bullshit Jobs”
> 
> ![Screenshot%20(445)|464x559](upload://rfmUcWLrUmIjkpfw7mx1Ype14vp.png)

It's interesting for us at Blivande to think about how this relates to us, and how we can break this cycle. Indeed, when it comes to creating community, that's something that a lot of companies do with "duct tape". How could we contribute to a different model? This is one of the questions at the heart of the Blivande project; how do we make sure that people who supply the world with community, beauty and social innovation get paid without having to sell-out and become duct taping "community managers" of some hipster infested start-up office?

On this topic, Edgeryders is hosting an online summit on **[Covid19 + Resilient Livelihoods: An Online Summit](https://edgeryders.eu/t/sneak-peek-covid19-resilient-livelihoods-an-online-summit/13296)**. We think that the current crisis might be an opportunity to come up with new models.

[quote="nadia, post:1, topic:13296"]
When a crisis hits, we look for systems of support & collaboration that go beyond the status quo. At this online summit we gather together people who deploy policies, infrastructures, tools, business activity and community projects that can form an essential support system for sustaining livelihoods in times of crisis.
[/quote]

![image|513x500](upload://vEWDaLIw5I6Yxb8y0L6TYC8cZ5E.jpeg) 

Noden is a radical experiment in community building and a year-around place for a wide variety of co-created and non-profit workshops and events.

What unites the activities taking place is that they are all created with the intention of bringing people together, ideally contributing towards reinforcing a sense of purpose and meaning in our everyday lives.

Hundreds of people come through our doors every week to visit this "home away from home" and we believe that we have, more often than not, succeeded in our mission of creating a transitional - and hopefully transformational - threshold or "twilight zone" in between the public and the private realm.

A place where things are open to change, and perhaps so are you. To some that can take for instance the form a [ ***drumming workshop*** ](https://www.facebook.com/events/2909786439062195/), a [ ***safe open stage*** ](https://www.facebook.com/groups/2089133457765779/) or a [ ***rave in complete darkness*** ](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1801604596752480/). But only if you and others actively choose to make it so by taking and sharing the necessary responsibility to make it happen. We are completely non-profit, co-created and member-motivation-based organisation!

It genuinely becomes what we make of it. And that's something to celebrate and explore!

This - in a nutshell - is Noden.

Noden is housed at Blivande, but it's an independent association with its own board and memberships. [Becoming a member of the Node](https://www.noden.community/membership) for 100 SEK per month can be a great first step into the Blivande community.

Yes, that's correct. PDU = Power Distribution Unit 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_distribution_unit

In relevant terms for Frihamnstorget and events like Borderland what is referred to as "Elbjörn" or "Uttagscentral" in Swedish. A small one looks like this: ![](upload://xAurQgYofcW68r1KBbQelkXAA3S.jpeg)

The big ones (like the red ones we also have) look like this: ![](upload://hoPQTC2bEJ2wppRKAheBRB9qdms.jpeg)

About the cost of electricity then sure, you can either invest in a more expensive PDU for BAM that has an integrated meter or you can buy cheaper external ones that you place between the PDU and whatever cables going out from it to some light or appliance.

My background is in aeronautical engineering (Stuttgart & KTH), but I've developed software most of the time.  The electronics stuff I'm not really trained in, so I'm frequently confused :)  But where there is a need...

2x 40A PSU 70 USD (who knows, if you blast the LED brightness we might need the extra juice)
Housing, cables and connectors 40 USD
Shipping 50 USD

**Total 370 USD / 3250 SEK**

I'm not going to lie guys this is incredibly frustrating. We (@jonasjohansson @elch and I) have been working on these LED install (primarily the holders) since the middle of August. We have discussed this across many different forms of media (forum, chat, in person) and I even presented this at the **townhall meeting in mid October** (with no feeback/suggestions of location change etc.). Every single one of these discussions resulted in how these tubes were designed specifically for the gallery container. **An extra effort was made** make them look super naijs **because these were supposed to eye-level and permanently part of the gallery.**

This includes:

* custom STL design of these holders rather than simple rubber endcaps 
* investing in brass 3D print filament which is quite $$
* a huge amount of time spent printing (since Oct), troubleshooting the printers, and removing the support 
* designing and building a tumbler so that these could be polished for full "effect" 

I have been responsive in putting in extra effort to get these finalized ASAP given the square's lighting push [here](https://forum.blivande.com/t/lighting-at-frihamnstorget/1576/4). In response to @NinaLindberg's call (fbook chat) for more lights in time for the secret experience yesterday, @elch actually tried to install the tubes on Monday but postponed due to the mess/noise it would make. This forum post was started was to discuss adjusting the gallery sign, not to discuss the location of the tubes. 

I am fully sympathetic to wanting to maintain the "look" of the gallery container. (The critique of LED tubes aesthetic not matching does seem a bit hypocritical given that the GALLERY sign also uses rainbow WS2811s but that's not particularly important.) I don't personally care where the tubes go - this isn't an ego-thing or something. I was told that the orange container bridge over the yellow made a dark spot of the square that sorely needed light. I suggested installing Jonas' old project, that was encouraged, and the three of us made it happen. Simple.

My frustration is that this location concern has never been previously mentioned - In the many discussions we've had about this over four months, if i had ever gotten a hint that there were considerations installing higher up (orange/red containers) or less prominently, I would have happily slapped some rubber endcaps on the tubes and been done with it. The extra effort on my behalf was specifically made in response to direct feedback that we should take this opportunity to give the gallery container this extra love and attention. 

This is a sore spot as I am experiencing a similar pattern with the [dome column design](https://forum.blivande.com/t/dome-temple-sketch/1327/22). A project is started -> others are consulted and a concept is discussed -> design is finalized and "signed off" -> a radically inclusive forum discussion starts which ultimately negates all the work done to that point. I value my time, and have no interest in spending where it is not of use. This pattern is discouraging and personally makes me hesitant to invest my time when the work will eventually be discarded.

The concern is not with  "existing marketing material" but rather that a permanent installation will shape the character and always be seen in context with whatever is inside. Blivande is turning 1 year old in February. It’s only a year ago that we opened the door to our house in the harbor. It feels crazy how far we have come in just a year. Our 2019 was about filling the house with atmosphere and getting it ready for the many years ahead of us. Our 2020 will be about growing our community, and we want to get off to a flying start!

So, we’re giving ourselves a birthday present, and we are hoping for that birthday present to be  *you* . We have decided to open up the house during all of February to prospective members. If you’ve been thinking about becoming a member, this is the time. If you sign up as a member now, you would only pay 1000 SEK in deposit for February to get the key, and then roll over to a regular membership on March 1st. If you decide to not stick with working at Blivande, you get the deposit back when you return the key.

![IMG_1067.jpg](https://forum.blivande.com/uploads/blivande/original/1X/d44fd1281a07faf27dd65d35f2c21807bc03941b.jpeg)

This is not an “open house”, but an offer to come have a conversation with us about becoming a member. We are creating a community, so we will figure out together if it is a good fit, which it usually is. Your intention should be to continue after February as a regular paying member, either on a flexible desk plan or with your own fixed desk.

## So, you’re ready to apply? Great!

1. Send us a short introduction, and we will decide a time for a quick chat in the house.
2. If we deem our visions and values aligned you are welcomed in for a trial month on a flexible desk plan.
3. You sign up and pay 1000 SEK in deposit. This is for the key, and for us to feel that we are making a mutual investment in each other. If you decide at the end of February that co-working at Blivande is not right for you, that amount will be reimbursed. If you continue, we will will deduct 1000 SEK from your first regular payment.
4. On March 1st, your membership automatically rolls over to a regular paid flexible membership, paid three months at a time.

![IMG_1080.jpg](https://forum.blivande.com/uploads/blivande/original/1X/32ee4b2b9348543c5027e76ac55e66d22d83bcb1.jpeg)

## Questions?

### I’m already a member, will I also get February for free?

We’re doing this to grow our community and bring more fantastic people to the house. Existing members don’t get a month off, but this is a perfect time to reach out to that person who you’ve always wanted to have at Blivande.

### What if I change my mind?

If you feel at the end of February that Blivande isn’t for you, you simply let us know and we end the trial membership and reimburse your 1000 SEK deposit when you return the key.

### Is access to the workshops of Studio Tau included in the trial?

Yes, absolutely! You get full access to the workshops like all members of the co-working space. In fact, we would very much welcome members who will use that opportunity.

### I want to become a Tau member, is this for me?

This offer is especially aimed at Studio Beta. Prospective members should be looking to become members of the co-working space. However, we might run something similar for the workshop memberships this spring.

# Notes from Urban gardening meeting

*On the 30th of April the initial Urban gardening meeting for Frihamnstorget following the initiative by @elch (Toby)  met on his balcony overlooking the square. Weather was sunny for a bit and increasingly cold. The Whiteboard was brought up to the balcony via the forklift, a very much appreciated gesture.*

## Let’s get in the greens: Urban Gardening at Frihamnstorget:

*What we discussed regarding the gardening:*

1. **Installing a watering system like in Tobi’s balcony**. Water pipes with holes and an attached timer make it easy to care for the crops. People could plant and them not worry much more about the plants:
![image|480x305](upload://du6Vcercw0DYdXYl19MaQ4rDyFs.jpeg) 
* Budget for water system:
* Less than 3000 to 4000 SEK in total Material costs
* @Thedodod  and @elch will start to set this up now either way. Thank you for the urban garden pipe heros!

2. **What type of planters?**
*Options:*
* Cut open metal tubes
* Like the existing wood boxes
* Green wall structures to be made during welding course
* Collaboration with[ “Hydrogarden”](https://www.hydrogarden.se/) contact through @Joannis-Magnus 
*Can we/ want we collaborate with Hydrogarden setting up a shop at Frihamn to get to have a planting experiment station/demonstration station there? Hydrogarden would need to find a shop space near Frihamnstorget. Could we help them get that?*

3. **Compost:** Toby will build it and we could all add to it at Frihamnen

4. **Bees** : (Tobee ;)):honeybee:
* @elch wants to get bees either way. We do not yet attach a budget. Will be explored later after more research
* @Frida_Simon have potential contacts to help to get some of the equipment
* Would mean it would be necessary to plant more flowers.
* Collaboration with open source/DIY initiatives (through Edgeryders) to make “open be hive technology workshops” (open hive: http://openhivescale.org/ , https://www.osbeehives.com/collections/source-files , … )

5. **Build an insect hotel:** material exists, could be turned into a workshop for work and play, or into a paid workshop for classes.
![image|530x500](upload://ilnGqb1mvqWSVjY8hV9cXSgc9cL.jpeg) 

6. **Greywater System**: clean greywater from Caffe using plants

Grey Water needs to be solved for Frihamnstorget in the long term view. However, we could only ever do that on a small scale as we won't have much soil. If then it would be more a limited “showroom” project. We would need to be very careful to not make the place look like a swamp.

11. **Funding and costs:**
*The new PLATO project uses a “[dreams and realities](https://frihamnstorget.dreams.wtf/)” system similar to borderland festivals. Plans and proposals can be put up there and funding can be organised and decided that way.*

**Regarding the 3000 to 4000 SEK, Blivande would be able and happy to provide that initial funding given that all of us subscribe to make the festival in September happen and amazing! :)**

### Peripherally connected notes:

*Stuff that came up, but is not just about the urban gardening.*

1. Wifi for Frihamnstorget: Can be established easily with a signal booster from the house

2. **Blivande/Frihamn could get necessary income via Festival planning/ticket selling for September:**

*”let's build an amazing magic hype 600 – 800 SEK for a weekend festival + access to work play at Frihamn mini membership.”*

* **Tickets for the festival would also give you access to work and play at Frihamnstorget.**

* **Work & play**:
PLANNED/DESIGNED EVENTS TWICE A MONTH (urban gardening and welding could be part of that)

3. For the big festival, we would probably rent a bigger part of the parking lot.

4. Tekniska Museet is interested in collaborating for outdoor events.
The museum would not pay for it, but the participants who could come through the museum could. (mainly children)

5. Welding courses: 3 machines from @toby + 3 Machines we could borrow

6. Connecting to maker places to “headhunt” them while they can not do much in inhouse places.

7. Having lockable bike storage would make the place more attractive for new members. COuld also be a welding course project.

## Decisions:

* **GO FOR IT** (for the pipes).
* Urban Gardening wanted in general
* Let’s plan and create more for the festival to enable all of the other plans
* Use Plato for the planning and financing: https://frihamnstorget.dreams.wtf/
* *People starting initiatives like this are very cool :)*

Thanks to the amazing Amalia we have this great poster. I have worked out a version based on the design by @Sero that uses a few different color schemes and varies Swedish and English. I think the idea should be that we try to put up two posters everywhere, one in Swedish and one in English, in different colors. When we post online, we can share different versions in different contexts. 

I decided to go with color versions after all. I think Sero is right in that it is important that the posters are eyecatching from a distance. Having a mosaic of colors makes it a lot less symbolically loaded to also use the blue and yellow theme, so I kept that in there too.

Images below are previews of the posters, [please use the high res versions when printing](https://drive.google.com/drive/u/1/folders/1w59OCHZtIOkp1F8iAy5fPRDBMEkq3BHh).

Also, this portrait format is not great for social media, I have also made a square version for use on Facebook and Instagram.

Frihamnen står inför en metamorfos. Under de kommande tio åren kommer det hända mycket i hamnen, när containertrafiken flyttas till Norvik och nya verksamheter fyller de tomma ytorna. Nya hus ska byggas, andra kommer rivas. Vissa verksamheter kanske flyttar ut och andra flyttar in. I tider när en stadsdel förändras snabbt finns det möjlighet att ta vara på behovet att kommunicera med varandra och bygga ett tätt nätverk mellan oss som är verksamma i hamnen. Det finns redan många kreativa och innovativa människor som arbetar i Frihamnen och fler ska vi bli. Tänk vilken stämning och sammanhållning vi kan skapa om vi börjar samarbeta?

## Varför grannsamverkan i Frihamnen?

Vi har en unik chans att skapa en pulserande, levande plats i mellanrummen som skapas mellan nybyggnationerna. Frihamnstorgets färglada containers och kommande konstgallerier är ett första exempel. Samtidigt är det viktigt att alla verksamheter som redan finns i Frihamnen fortsätter fungera bra med det nya som kommer. Allt det blir mycket lättare om vi börjar prata med varandra. Därför har vi bjudit in er till den här gruppen. Vi kommer att använda den för att lägga upp förslag, diskussioner och idéer. 

## Vilka står bakom?

Vi som står bakom heter [Blivande](https://www.blivande.com), och vi driver ett hus för kreativt arbete, participatorisk kultur och events på korsningen Liljas gata och Södra hamnvägen i Frihamnen. Huset drivs av @hampus, @Linnea och mig [tillsammans med vårt community](https://forum.blivande.com/t/what-have-we-been-up-to-prior-to-joining-tau/102/20). På parkeringen intill driver vi [Frihamnstorget](https://forum.blivande.com/t/frihamnstorget-founding-constitution/405) som vi vill låta blomma ut till Frihamnens nya mötesplats och experimentverkstad för kultur, konst och kreativt entreprenörskap.

Vi på Blivande använder redan ett forum för att planera [Frihamnstorget](https://forum.blivande.com/t/frihamnstorget-founding-constitution/405) och huset [Blivande](https://forum.blivande.com/c/blivande-community). Ta en titt där för att se hur det kan funka. 

Tekniskt sköts forumet av [Edgeryders](https://edgeryders.eu/t/our-company/6640), ett europeiskt nätverk för community-baserad kollektiv intelligens. Edgeryders och Blivande hänger ihop genom att Edgeryders has sin nordiska bas på Blivande. Jag sitter i styrelsen för Edgeryders och @MariaEuler, verksam konstnär i huset Blivande, jobbar också som community manager för Edgeryders.  

## Varför ett forum?

Vi har märkt att ett forum är bättre för att hålla koll på många trådar och samarbeten än till exempel en Facebook grupp, en Slack eller en email lista. Dessutom är det många som försöker komma bort från de sociala mediernas hets och larm. Det är också många arbetsplatser som inte gillar att Facebook används på arbetstid, och eftersom vi vill vara en plats för utbyte mellan företag och organisationer i Frihamnen känns det mer naturligt att ha ett forum. När du blivit medlem i forumet kan kan du också få mail när någon taggar dig, eller när det kommer nya trådar. Då kan du svara direkt på mailen och de hamnar i forumet utan att du ens behöver logga in. 

Vi har också skapat [en Facebook-grupp](https://www.facebook.com/groups/552703455304673) eftersom vi vet att det kan vara enklare för många. Det funkar ofta bra att ha kortare diskussioner och snabba notiser i en Facebook-grupp. Vi håller koll på båda platserna och ser var vi får momentum helt enkelt.

I think we should become a member of Trans Europe Halles. It's only 300 EUR per year if we get accepted, which is a pretty [long process in 8 steps](http://teh.net/become-a-member/). Once we're in though, it lends us some weight and credibility. I started the process by filling in the form on their site. 

http://teh.net/about-us/

# Inventory:

1. "Box of hot space" or "Not (just) a sauna" by @Thedodod



# 1. “Box of hot space” “Not (just) a sauna”

![|600x400](upload://6dkj7Mwoq97iguUMgL2tF8cVoxo.png)

This is not (just) a sauna! Multifunctional tiny house exploration with seethrough walls, LEDs and Climate control. It is a box of hot space!

**Motivation:**

What if your house could travel, grow, shrink and change with you or your community?

![|462x250](upload://cAWpVenN3opp9TQ2wbxaYi3FmKu.gif)

**The Big Picture:**

“Cluster House Projects” is a team of 3 people planning a tiny revolution with modular tiny houses. The “box of hot space” is a prototype, proof of concept, a gift to the community and a labour of love.

 (Theodore Zombory (@Thedodod owner of Porla AB), Emilie Dafgård (architect) and Aras Sedaghat Amoli have been working on this pioneering project for a while as a foundation for a bigger tiny house development project. Finally, there will be multiple mobile tiny house modules which can work on their own or as a collection to create new living and community spaces. Porla AB provides expertise regarding installation and water systems for the project.

The 3 pioneers have already invested a lot of time and 50 000 SEK of their own money. The trailer and the skeleton of the first tiny “not (just) a sauna” are standing.

**The Plan for the “box of hot space”:**

The plan is to cover the walls with sheets of see-through plastic and to install LED’s connected to a temperature sensor as well as an AC and a heating system in the “hot box”.

They would be happy to open this magical temperature-controlled shiny box of totally cool hot space to the community to sweat or chill together.

First use could be a hot or cool hangout space during the festival.

**What they need now:**

* Help with the electronics of the trailer.
* See-through plastic material for the walls: 30 000 SEK
* Heating system: 10 000 SEK
* LED’s and temperature sensors: 5000 SEK
* Help to programme those temperature sensors and LED’s to reflect the atmosphere in the box.

**Do you want a mobile glowing spar on Fihamnstorget?**

Get in here and lend a hand or chip in some budget. Everyone who helps to realise this project during the summer can come back this winter to warm up in the box!

Once realised the box could be used and rented for even more functions.

**What the module could be used for:**

* spar/sauna

* Cooling space in the summer

* Kitchen/cafe

* Dining room

* Conference room

* Photo studio

* Mobile Festival home

With this proof of concept realised and running more wonderful tiny house modules with large potential could follow.

A fixed desk also means that you have the right to put up shelves on the wall above your work station and to place some drawers next to your desk. You can also store things under your desk, or next to it. Of course, you need to be aware of the people around you and not claim more space than is reasonable. *On the 30th of April the initial Urban gardening meeting for Frihamnstorget following the initiative by @elch (Toby)  met on his balcony overlooking the square. Weather was sunny for a bit and increasingly cold. The Whiteboard was brought up to the balcony via the forklift, a very much appreciated gesture.*

# Notes from Urban gardening meeting

## Let’s get in the greens: Urban Gardening at Frihamnstorget:

*What we discussed regarding the gardening:*

1. **Installing a watering system like in Tobi’s balcony**. Water pipes with holes and an attached timer make it easy to care for the crops. People could plant and them not worry much more about the plants:
![image|480x305](upload://du6Vcercw0DYdXYl19MaQ4rDyFs.jpeg) 
* Budget for water system:
* Less than 3000 to 4000 SEK in total Material costs
* @Thedodod  and @elch will start to set this up now either way. Thank you for the urban garden pipe heros!

2. **What type of planters?**
*Options:*
* Cut open metal tubes
* Like the existing wood boxes
* Green wall structures to be made during welding course
* Collaboration with[ “Hydrogarden”](https://www.hydrogarden.se/) contact through @Joannis-Magnus 
*Can we/ want we collaborate with Hydrogarden setting up a shop at Frihamn to get to have a planting experiment station/demonstration station there? Hydrogarden would need to find a shop space near Frihamnstorget. Could we help them get that?*

3. **Compost:** Toby will build it and we could all add to it at Frihamnen

4. **Bees** : (Tobee ;)):honeybee:
* @elch wants to get bees either way. We do not yet attach a budget. Will be explored later after more research
* @Frida_Simon have potential contacts to help to get some of the equipment
* Would mean it would be necessary to plant more flowers.
* Collaboration with open source/DIY initiatives (through Edgeryders) to make “open be hive technology workshops” (open hive: http://openhivescale.org/ , https://www.osbeehives.com/collections/source-files , … )

5. **Build an insect hotel:** material exists, could be turned into a workshop for work and play, or into a paid workshop for classes.
![image|530x500](upload://ilnGqb1mvqWSVjY8hV9cXSgc9cL.jpeg) 

6. **Greywater System**: clean greywater from Caffe using plants

Grey Water needs to be solved for Frihamnstorget in the long term view. However, we could only ever do that on a small scale as we won't have much soil. If then it would be more a limited “showroom” project. We would need to be very careful to not make the place look like a swamp.

11. **Funding and costs:**
*The new PLATO project uses a “[dreams and realities](https://dreams.wtf/)” system similar to borderland festivals. Plans and proposals can be put up there and funding can be organised and decided that way.*

**Regarding the 3000 to 4000 SEK, Blivande would be able and happy to provide that initial funding given that all of us subscribe to make the festival in September happen and amazing! :)**

### Peripherally connected notes:

*Stuff that came up, but is not just about the urban gardening.*

1. Wifi for Frihamnstorget: Can be established easily with a signal booster from the house

2. **Blivande/Frihamn could get necessary income via Festival planning/ticket selling for September:**

*”let's build an amazing magic hype 600 – 800 SEK for a weekend festival + access to work play at Frihamn mini membership.”*

* **Tickets for the festival would also give you access to work and play at Frihamnstorget.**

* **Work & play**:
PLANNED/DESIGNED EVENTS TWICE A MONTH (urban gardening and welding could be part of that)

3. For the big festival, we would probably rent a bigger part of the parking lot.

4. Tekniska Museet is interested in collaborating for outdoor events.
The museum would not pay for it, but the participants who could come through the museum could. (mainly children)

5. Welding courses: 3 machines from @elch + 3 Machines we could borrow

6. Connecting to maker places to “headhunt” them while they can not do much in inhouse places.

7. Having lockable bike storage would make the place more attractive for new members. COuld also be a welding course project.

## Decisions:

* **GO FOR IT** (for the pipes).
* Urban Gardening wanted in general
* Let’s plan and create more for the festival to enable all of the other plans
* Use Plato for the planning and financing, URL coming soon!
* *People starting initiatives like this are very cool :)*

Since we started on April 2d, our volunteers have produced over 12000 gowns.

We have delivered to care providers all over Stockholm, including NKS, Axelsberg Vårdcentral, multiple Attendo nursing homes, Lidingö kommun nursing homes, Rio Gärdet nursing home, Kista vård & omsorg, Kavat nursing homes, Baggenfjärdens hemtjänst AB, Hägersten/Liljeholmen stadsdelsförvaltning.

We collaborate with other organizations in civil society, like WeFightCovid19 with Volvo LV, makers in Gothenburg, [Stockholm Makerspace](https://www.makerspace.se/) and [CCAP](https://www.ccap.se) in Farsta. 

This makes a big difference, especially for retirement homes, small clinics, and personnel working in home-care situations. 

![Gowns delivered](https://forum.blivande.com/uploads/blivande/original/1X/fc0a322083d072495adec77a0c8c7dc839c2ba48.jpeg)

Hello!

I was a member of Stugan, and I'm trying to finding a good space to make more fun projects in 2020 and beyond. Since Stugan got demolished I tried to see if I could get by with my own space...which have "worked" - but have really missed having access to proper tools, clever people and just a bit more working space for larger projects (especially access to a laser cutter). 


If you didn't meet me at Stugan, short introduction:

Professionally I'm a Technical 3D artist, working mainly in the games industry. In my free time, I like to craft costumes and props for LARP, cosplay and the fetish scene. I try to keep this crafting to be for me, for fun things that interest me and very rarely sell pieces or make any commissions.

I'm good at 3d modeling and sculpting, design, game development, VR/AR, UI/UX, costume making, EVA-foam, worbla, distressing materials, latex vulcanizing, laser cutting.
I'm also decent at electronics and programming, soldering, VJ-ing,  a bunch of adjacent crafts and some general problem-solving.

I like helping out whenever and wherever I can and share my knowledge if anyone wants it :)

Some stuff I've made:
![SomStuff4|690x448](upload://4wo4bWjTbICYiDWFeIw3vH25E9M.jpeg) 
( You can find more of my art at https://www.instagram.com/bjornalbihn/?hl=sv )

I would really like to come to talk and have a look at the Tau whenever anyone can show it to me. :)

We are building on the vast knowledge of the international community making open-source personal protective equipment. You can download instructions and blueprints below.

**Visors**
* [Files to produce hold-on face shields with a laser cutter](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/wqur2ucgynw7wgf/AADG6lfYcR-aGW6b9XQKwLEQa?dl=0).

**Long-sleeved gowns**
Pattern originally developed by [Stockholm Makerspace](https://www.makerspace.se/). At Blivande, we are able to produce around 350 of these gowns per day.

* Pattern for gown production, on A4 sheets [(Swedish)](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1aycIILqxWF61BtUQzt2o91_108y974aE) [(English)](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ONn7R6OB15RSYnlGKQajlf0uvp8R8lhk)
* Step by step instructions for gown production [(English)](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1IOtvYWFO4dKMyPfz-TLTUut4PyG82EkKAenLN1n0k7w/edit?usp=sharing) [(French)](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1OR5DlyG9eppkDJ_0PfBZq3FKFL4qmD4GD38MKJi8OSE) [(Arabic)](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1w_oM-ayBRQll2vF961cVMGFlFNlSEy0CChhSW0Wgr4c/edit?usp=sharing) [(Spanish)](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1UpYu7vPaXWAP5SOzStZFZLFP9LFB5aAtvkf_kvlK1Ec)

Below is an instruction video from Stockholm Makerspace, who came up with the design. We have slightly modified their protocol, but this also works well.

https://forum.blivande.com/uploads/blivande/original/1X/106c0d95a9dad1fb38878abdf8f1cdf2b2913327.mp4

We think that this design and production method can be very valuable for use in other countries hit later by the pandemic. Since the materials are cheap, and no special equipment is needed, this should be possible even in regions with severe material restrictions. We would be more than happy to help you set up a gown production facility in your home country. If you have any questions, [make a comment in our forum](https://forum.blivande.com/t/5-can-you-share-your-blueprints-and-instructions/910) and we will try out best to help you get started.

Dear Corona Survivors,

Lets drink less and draw more nude models after work. Once corona panic has settled I will be arranging a kroki cirkel (lifedrawing cirkle) after work every Friday in the techno temple at Blivande at Frihamnen, the port of Stockholm. 

The layout will be like any other lifedrawing circle with a nude modell posing in the middle and people sitting in a circle around the modell drawing. But with a little bit of a twist because there will be music and drinks for sale, giving it a little bit more of an afterwork relaxed feel. 

There will be a theme each week on different drawing techniques for those who want to learn the basics of drawing, but it is also ok to just rock up and do your own thing. 

We aim to cater both for those who just want to draw and those who wants to learn something - and those who wants to socialise a little.  

There will be 2, 5, 10, and 20 minutes poses for 2 hours with a 15 min break in the middle, starting from 18 - 20. People are also welcome to stay after for as long as we are open. 

People will need to bring their own materials but we provide model and pillows to sit on. Since the floor in the techno temple is already soft its not a disaster if we run out of pillows. 

I will be leading the first classes but I am happy to have people to help me so we can do this in shifts, that way no one is bound to attend every Friday. People needed for every shift is one model, one "circle leader", and one DJ/bartender. The circle leader is to tell the model when to switch poses and to introduce the course to all the participants. The DJ/bartender needs to do bartender during the break and after for those who stay after the drawing is finished to socialise. 

For now I am thinking modell will get 500kr, plus tip. The circle leader and dj/bartender might get something too in the long run if this is successful, maybe 400kr per event as well. But for the first times it will only be the model that gets paid, until we get a lot of people coming.  Feel free to give your opinion about this because I am not sure what is regarded as fair by everyone. 

Entrance is 100 kr and food and beverage prices same as any other blivande event. 

Remaining profits will go towards blivande. So for the first event we have to make more than 500kr to gain profits, for future events more than 1300kr if we are to pay the rest of the arrangers. 

Please let me know if you have any feedback or if you wish to be a model, circle leader or dj/barstaff. 

Stay healthy xxxxx

Hey all'y'all!
Now I've finally found time to finalize the plans for the woodshop. See plans below. Input/questions welcome.
• The wall between the current woodshop and Vins's room will be torn down. The door to Vins's former room will be blocked off.
• Along the Southern wall (the outer wall) there will be a 7.5 m long workbench, consisting of six cabinets. One of these tailored to be suited for fine hand tool work, and another one tailored with a trench to house the chop saw. This gives us tonnes of storage space for machines, tool, hardware and so on underneath. 
• Along the same wall hand tool storage boards will be mounted across the lower portion of the windows, for easy access and good overview.
• Along the opposite wall we'll park the stationary machines on their individual carts, from where they can easily be pulled out and placed wherever one wants to use them.
• Above the stationary machines we can add some shelfing for longer goods.
• Shelfing on both end walls.

As you can see on the attached excel sheet
the price spans on plywood in table 1 indicate various qualities of plywood. The lowest figures would mean cheaper material, but possibly some extra work and a somewhat shittier interior in the shop, whereas the more expensive end would mean quicker assembly and a nicer result. I'd personally go for the upper price range. 
Doors to the cabinets underneath the workbench would mean an additional cost as well, same gpes for the shelves. The price spans for the total cost of the shop are presented in table 2.

Once Vins has moved out of her room, we could get started with the construction of the woodshop. I suggest we do it in steps as follows:
1. Tear down separation wall.
2. Block off door.
3. Do the finishing and the touch-up work on the walls.
4. Build the cabinets and the carts in the Flamingo room
5. Mount mirror film or similar on the windows in the woodshop. (Not included in calculation)
6. Install cabinets and carts in the woodshop.
7. Clean-up and treatment of wood surfaces.

Then there is the financing of all this stuff... We talked about a support party to raise the funds needed, and @hampus would write a post on the forum, but I guess we're chilling with that due to pandemic-type stuff...

## Introducing Plato to Blivande

I have the pleasure of announcing a major project today. We are being [funded by Vinnova](https://www.vinnova.se/p/plato-digitala-verktyg-for-participatorisk-placemaking/) to create digital tools for participatory placemaking. Blivande is heavily involved in this project and it will bring a lot of fresh energy and opportunities, especially to Frihamnstorget. [You can read the proposal here to better understand the project](https://docs.google.com/document/d/162eLn05-9HB6VGKw4Bpw-rZQJh4pwNsyCUTXYmhTgDk/edit?usp=sharing). SenseStack, the coordinator of this project, is a company set up to be an extension of [Edgeryders](https://start.edgeryders.eu/) in Stockholm, partially owned by Blivande. This post acts both as an announcement of the project to the community, and as an introduction of the Plato team to the platform. 

## Summary of the project

Plato combines technologies that we have built for the Borderland and Edgeryders over the years into a "suite" of tools for placemaking. These tools include [Dreams](https://dreams.wtf/), [Realities](http://realities.theborderland.se/graph), [Graphryder](https://graphryder1.edgeryders.eu/), [Open Ethnographer](https://edgeryders.eu/t/open-ethnographer-manual/6811), and Discourse (this forum). We will integrate all of these tools with each other, allow them to share data, and enable a single login to all of them through the account a user has on the forum.

We will use this suite of tools to activate Frihamnstorget, to map out the different projects and their budgets, map out the different responsibilities and their dependencies, document contacts with authorities and build a great community. Frihamnstorget will get its own Dreams platform, Realities platform and the conversations on the forum will be visualized in a graph showing the connections between people, ideas and projects. We use this forum as the starting point and all platforms will integrate with the forum through a single login.

We will also use Frihamnstorget as a place for experimentation for students at Stockholm University, studying placemaking and participatory urban planning. During their education, these students will use Plato and participate in developing the methodology and feedback on the UX/UI.

Finally, these tools and methods will be documented, and a proposal written for how it can be used by municipalities, schools, real estate developers and other organizations. Our goal is to turn this technology and methodology into a product that we can sell, providing an income for Blivande and for people in the community.

## Work packages

### WP1: Software development
This is approximately 50% of the budget, including programming, UX/UI work, project management and overhead costs like seats at Blivande for the developers.

### WP2: Study into implementation potential
This part of the project is carried out by Ylva and Diana and will take place during the second half of the project.

### WP3: Workshops
These are workshops we will do with Stockholm University and Frihamnstorget creators to plan new developments. These workshops will also have a production budget tied to them that we can use to make Dreams into Realities.

### WP4: Implementation of Plato on Frihamnstorget
We use the tools we develop for Frihamnstorget. This work package includes budgets for project management of Frihamnstorget (@hampus), online/offline community management and ethnography. 

## Plato team (so far)

I will be leading the project together with @jakobskote. Roughly, I will focus on delivering the technology and Jakob will focus on delivering the methodology. Our split of hours is to be determined, but I will most likely be working on the project a bit more than Jakob. 

@hampus will be leading practical work at Frihamnstorget, and of making sure that everyone who is working at Frihamnstorget gets onboarded to the Plato platform. 

@gustav is our first hire as a developer and he will be working around half time on Plato throughout the project. He has recently been working on the new Dreams and has worked on Realities before that. 

[Ragnar Lund](https://www.su.se/profiles/ralu3052-1.191473) is our collaborator at Stockholm University, where he teaches placemaking in two courses.

[Ylva Björnberg](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ylvabjornberg/?originalSubdomain=se) and [Diana Uppman](https://www.linkedin.com/in/diana-uppman-25734992/) (yet to join the platform) will be in charge of writing the report on how to scale Plato and turn it into an offer for municipalities and other organizations.

[Amelia Hassoun](https://edgeryders.eu/t/amelia-hassoun/10934) will be our expert advisor on ethnography, both on how it is done on the platform and also on how to do it specifically for participatory urbanism.

## People we want to involve soon

@MariaEuler, I would love to involve you in both forum community management of the Blivande/Frihamnstorget forum, and in other aspects too. It would be fantastic to have you on this project with us. Let me know if there is anything you are particularly interested in. We have budget earmarked for community management.

@SofiaAnner and I have already talked about her being involved, as she is already working closely with @hampus, @Sero and me on outreach and engagement for Blivande.

@matthias and @daniel, there is plenty of Discourse work here. I would love to work with you on this if you have the time. We will want to use Edgeryders as the SSO server, develop plugins to display information from Dreams and Realities on the Discourse front-end.
 
@Frida_Simon, it would be great to involve you as someone who is both building art at Frihamnstorget and as someone who has a lot of experience in the field.

All members are very welcome to think about if and how they would like to contribute to the project. I would also love to involve the creative powers of 
 and the Node (@kimgajraj). 

If you want to be involved somehow, this is the time to let us know. To manage expectations, most of the budget is earmarked for software development and major project management roles, so you will probably not be paid in this project unless you are highly engaged and take responsibility for delivery. Importantly, many of us who have been working on Blivande for free can now get paid salaries temporarily through this project, which is a huge relief. However, there are plenty of ways that this project can work for you and what you want to do, even if its is not in a paid role. 

Perhaps you want to plan a big event at Frihamnstorget and we can set up a Dreams instance for you? Perhaps you are planning to do something very complicated that requires a lot of people to stay in the loop, and you could benefit from project management through realities? Or perhaps you want to use the PR-value of having Edgeryders and a Vinnova-funded project and plan a participatory art event that you sell tickets to and apply to grants for? Let's try to make this project sprout a thousand beautiful tentacles for the community.

## Timeline

We will be ramping up in April and should be up and running in May. This project will be ongoing until June 2021. In the first phase, from April to June, we will be mostly focused on project planning and software development. Ideally, we can use these tools to launch a participatory build festival week for Frihamnstorget this summer. 

## Next steps 

We need to gather our core teams, set up some timelines and get to work. @jakobskote and I will reach out soon with some more information.

Finally, announcing the project like this is a part of how we work at Blivande and at Edgeryders. You can read more about our principles of collaboration here:

https://forum.blivande.com/t/principles-of-collaboration-in-the-plato-project/828?u=hugi

Hi guys! :wave: I'm aiina, an artist, digital designer, burner and regular attendee at the Freeflow event at Noden where I'm also a member.

I'm collaborating with an artist colleague (Jonas) in Switzerland, and in October 2019 we built an installation called "Mirror Box" at the Metamodern Arts Festival i Kiev. A box internally covered with mirrors, showcased in the form of an immersive experience. Unfortunately we couldn't get the box out of Ukraine due to the crazy transportation costs. 

Looked like this:
![09|329x500](upload://xGggNxKKHZx8koq7HiACKWNds6H.png) 

Therefore we're right now looking into how to build the Mirror Box 2.0, in a space where the box could be somewhat "permanent". After an idea planted in my head by @jakobskote, me and Jonas started to look into the possibilities of creating the installation inside of a container - and right now we're really optimistic about this.

We would really love our artwork to be more of a communal space, that could be used by the community around Blivande for workshops, public events, container mini-raves or wherever your imagination takes you! We want the box to come to **life** and not being some temporarily object in a gallery. We would love to build a container version of the box at Frihamnstorget!

I've read most of the info about the Frihamnstorget project and hope that someone could point me in the right direction from here to get things rolling! We hope you like our idea and looking forward to get involved in this great project!

Hej! Jag har gjort en version av ett skyddsvisir för laserskärning som testats med framgång på två vårdcentraler och de är mycket nöjda, och har bett om mer till sina grannvårdcentraler. 

Den saknar idag ett horisontellt droppskydd, men har en högt vertikalt skydd. Det går att lösa med skumgummi, eller någon annan smart design... (Har dock ej fått önskemål om droppskydd ifrån användare eller chef på vårdcentral som tagit emot. Har levererat både dessa och 3dverkstans, de föredrog denna pga den var bekvämare att bära.)

**Tillverkning**
Laserskärare eller cncfräs.  I en 100w laser tar det ca 1 minut per pannband. 
Just nu använder jag mest overheadfilm, och den gör jag markeringar på utifrån en mall och borrar sedan hål i 10-20 ark åt gången med metallborr. 

**Montering**
De fästes samman med två buntband och det tar ungefär 45sek-1minut att montera. 

**Material**
Pannbandet är Polypropylen ca1mm, som ska klara upp till 120-125C. 
Skärmen är olika material beroende på vad som finns till hands. Just nu overheadfilm eller PETG. 
Bandet fästes med gummiband eller resårband baktill. 

**Rengöring**
Isärmonterade bör de vara enkla att bada i desinfektionslösning. Har ej testats med autoklav. 

**Ladda ner**
Testa och utveckla gärna designen här: 
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/wqur2ucgynw7wgf/AADG6lfYcR-aGW6b9XQKwLEQa?dl=0

I think me and Nina would also love something in this style for our container. Monochrome contrasted with bright pastel colored windows. 
Also like the fornasetti style a lot

There's a company called Foam King that seems to be market leader when it comes to polyurethane foam insulation. That works very well for containers as you mention. Might be worth looking into as well. Probably a bit more expensive materialwise but it will save you time in construction. So depends on how you value that balance between time and money. 

https://www.foamking.se/kontakt/kontakt-foam-king-stockholm/

Another idea is to use our connection with Containertjänst and see if you can buy the ready-made styrofoam/EPS wall pieces that they use when they insulate their containers. They come already glued together with construction plywood. It's the exact same type of insulation used in our laser cutter (and CNC!) container. 

If you sweet talk them you might be able to buy it (they probably have shit tons in stock) and then mount it yourself? And if not they might still give you the contact details of their supplier, but I wouldn't be surprised if your order would be too insignificant for them to want to bother as wholesalers. But you never you! If you mention the type of project you're working with chances are they can be convinced to sponsor you.

Jag har en FlashForge Finder 3D-printer, som har en max utskriftsyta av 15x15 cm. Det innebär att 3D-verkstans visirhållare inte går att printa ut för
